articles.author: Andrew Macaskill, Elizabeth Piper, Alistair Smout
articles.description: Keir Starmer will be Britain's next prime minister with his Labour Party set to win a massive majority in a parliamentary election, an exit poll on Thursday indicated, while Rishi Sunak's Conservatives are forecast to suffer historic losses.
articles.title: UK's Labour on course for massive election majority, exit poll shows

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Mohammad Salem, Maayan Lubell
articles.description: Efforts to secure a ceasefire and hostage release in Gaza were gathering momentum on Friday after Hamas made a revised proposal on the terms of a deal and Israel said it would resume stalled negotiations.
articles.title: Gaza ceasefire hopes rise as Israel says it will resume stalled negotiations

articles.author: Anna Voitenko, Alina Smutko
articles.description: Russian forces are advancing slowly but surely in Toretsk, pummelling the devastated eastern Ukrainian town night and day with rockets, artillery fire and air attacks.
articles.title: Time running out for Ukrainians fleeing Russia's advance

articles.author: Karen Lema
articles.description: The Philippines has turned down offers from the United States to assist operations in the South China Sea, after a flare-up with China over missions to resupply Filipino troops on a contested shoal, its military chief said.
articles.title: Exclusive: Philippines turned down US help amid South China Sea tensions - military chief

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Six Palestinians were killed in an Israeli military offensive on the West Bank city of Jenin on Friday, the Palestinian health ministry said.
articles.title: Six Palestinians killed in Israeli offensive on West Bank's Jenin, ministry says

articles.author: Anthony Deutsch, Stephanie Van Den Berg, Humeyra Pamuk
articles.description: On May 20, the same day International Criminal Court prosecutor Karim Khan made a surprise request for warrants to arrest the leaders of Israel and Hamas involved in the Gaza conflict, he suddenly cancelled a sensitive mission to collect evidence in the region, eight people with direct knowledge of the matter told Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: ICC prosecutor opted for warrants over visit to Gaza

articles.author: Elizabeth Piper
articles.description: The recriminations and jostling for top positions among Britain's Conservative lawmakers began long before Thursday's crushing election defeat to Labour that some party figures said left the party facing the prospect of a decade out of power.
articles.title: UK's Conservatives face leadership "bloodbath" as party seeks new direction

articles.author: Parisa Hafezi
articles.description: Iranians will vote in a run-off presidential election on Friday amid voter apathy and heightened regional tensions.
articles.title: Iranians vote in run-off presidential election amid widespread apathy

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hurricane Beryl caused devastating damage in several Caribbean islands, the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies (IFRC) said on Friday as the Category 3 storm churned towards Mexico's Yucatan Peninsula.
articles.title: Hurricane Beryl leaves 'devastating' damage in Caribbean, IFRC says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Eruptions at Italy's Mount Etna and the smaller Stromboli volcano spewed hot ash and lava, raising alert levels on the Mediterranean island of Sicily and forcing a temporary shutdown of Catania Airport on Friday.
articles.title: Italy's Etna and Stromboli volcanoes erupt, Catania Airport closed
